263.description: Provides a quick injection of power into your capacitor. Good for tight situations!
263.name: Cap Booster 25

264.description: Provides a quick injection of power into your capacitor. Good for tight situations!
264.name: Cap Booster 50

266.description: A small rocket with a piercing warhead.
266.name: Scourge Rocket

267.description: An ultra-heavy piercing missile. While it is a slow projectile, its sheer damage potential is simply staggering.
267.name: Scourge Torpedo

269.description: An Amarr light missile with an EMP warhead and automatic guidance system.
269.name: Mjolnir Auto-Targeting Light Missile I

377.description: Increases the maximum strength of the shield.
377.name: Small Shield Extender I

380.description: Increases the maximum strength of the shield.
380.name: Small Shield Extender II

393.description: Improves the recharge rate of the shield.
393.name: Shield Recharger I

394.description: Improves the recharge rate of the shield.
394.name: Shield Recharger II

399.description: Expends energy to provide a quick boost in shield strength.
399.name: Small Shield Booster I

400.description: Expends energy to provide a quick boost in shield strength.
400.name: Small Shield Booster II

434.description:
Massive boost to speed for a very short time. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module. The sheer amount of energy needed to power this system means that it must permanently reserve a fraction of the capacitor output just to maintain the integrity of its warp containment field, and when activated it substantially increases the ship's EM footprint.

Penalty: Max capacitor reduced.

Note: Usually fit on Frigates and Destroyers.
434.name: 5MN Microwarpdrive I

438.description:
Gives a boost to the maximum velocity of the ship when activated. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module.

Note: Usually fit on Frigates and Destroyers.
438.name: 1MN Afterburner II

439.description:
Gives a boost to the maximum velocity of the ship when activated. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module.

Note: Usually fit on Frigates and Destroyers.
439.name: 1MN Afterburner I

440.description:
Massive boost to speed for a very short time. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module. The sheer amount of energy needed to power this system means that it must permanently reserve a fraction of the capacitor output just to maintain the integrity of its warp containment field, and when activated it substantially increases the ship's EM footprint.

Penalty: Max capacitor reduced.

Note: Usually fit on Frigates and Destroyers.
440.name: 5MN Microwarpdrive II

442.description: Scans the cargo hold of another ship.
442.name: Cargo Scanner I

443.description: Scans the target ship and provides a tactical analysis of its capabilities. The further it goes beyond scan range, the more inaccurate its results will be.
443.name: Ship Scanner I

444.description: Scans the composition of asteroids, ice and gas clouds.
444.name: Survey Scanner I

447.description: Disrupts the target ship's navigation computer, disabling warping, jumping, microwarpdrives and micro jump drives.
447.name: Warp Scrambler I

448.description: Disrupts the target ship's navigation computer, disabling warping, jumping, microwarpdrives and micro jump drives.
448.name: Warp Scrambler II

450.description:
Rapid fire multi-barreled energy weapon that delivers a steady stream of damage. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
450.name: Gatling Pulse Laser I

451.description:
This light pulse laser uses two separate laser focusing systems to reduce the cool down period between shots. Good skirmish weapon. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
451.name: Dual Light Pulse Laser I

452.description:
This light beam laser uses two separate laser focusing systems to reduce the cool down period between shots. Good short to medium range weapon. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
452.name: Dual Light Beam Laser I

453.description:
A high-powered pulse laser. Good for short to medium range encounters. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
453.name: Small Focused Pulse Laser I

454.description:
A high-powered beam laser. Good for medium range encounters. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
454.name: Small Focused Beam Laser I

455.description:
Uses four light laser focusing systems. Low powered, but makes up for it with a fast firing rate. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
455.name: Quad Light Beam Laser I

456.description:
A high-energy, concentrated laser designed for short to medium range engagements. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
456.name: Focused Medium Pulse Laser I

457.description:
A high-energy, concentrated laser designed for medium range engagements. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
457.name: Focused Medium Beam Laser I

458.description:
A heavy laser designed for short to medium range engagements. Delivers powerful damage. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
458.name: Heavy Pulse Laser I

459.description:
A high-energy heavy laser designed for medium range engagements. Delivers powerful damage. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
459.name: Heavy Beam Laser I

460.description:
This heavy pulse laser uses two separate laser focusing systems to reduce the cool down period between shots. A great weapon for medium to long range encounters. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
460.name: Dual Heavy Pulse Laser I

461.description:
This heavy beam laser uses two separate laser focusing systems to reduce the cool down period between shots. A great weapon for medium to long range encounters. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
461.name: Dual Heavy Beam Laser I

462.description:
A super-heavy pulse laser designed for medium range engagements. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
462.name: Mega Pulse Laser I

463.description:
A super-heavy beam laser designed for medium to long range engagements. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
463.name: Mega Beam Laser I

464.description:
An ultra-heavy beam laser designed for medium to long range engagements. 

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
464.name: Tachyon Beam Laser I

482.description: Has an improved technology beam, making the extraction process more efficient. Useful for extracting all but the rarest ore.
482.name: Miner II

483.description: Basic mining laser. Extracts common ore quickly, but has difficulty with the more rare types.
483.name: Miner I

484.description:
This multi-barrel autocannon is designed for skirmish warfare. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
484.name: 125mm Gatling AutoCannon I

485.description:
A simple but effective close combat autocannon. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
485.name: 150mm Light AutoCannon I

486.description:
A powerful autocannon that can smash apart most lightly armored frigates with ease. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
486.name: 200mm AutoCannon I

487.description:
This artillery is one of the most powerful weapons that can be mounted on a frigate. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
487.name: 250mm Light Artillery Cannon I

488.description:
Rocket-assisted artillery projectiles designed for long-range combat. It is the most powerful projectile weapon able to be fitted onto frigates. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
488.name: 280mm Howitzer Artillery I

489.description:
This dual 180mm autocannon is a simple but effective close combat weapon. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
489.name: Dual 180mm AutoCannon I

490.description:
The 220mm multi-barrel autocannon is designed for skirmish warfare. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
490.name: 220mm Vulcan AutoCannon I

491.description:
The 425mm is a behemoth that will inflict severe damage on most cruisers and frigates in short-range battles. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
491.name: 425mm AutoCannon I

492.description:
A powerful long-range cannon. One of the most damaging weapons mountable on a cruiser. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
492.name: 650mm Artillery Cannon I

493.description:
This 720mm rocket-assisted howitzer is designed for long-range bombardment. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
493.name: 720mm Howitzer Artillery I

494.description:
Combines the damage output of two 425mm intermediate-range autocannons. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
494.name: Dual 425mm AutoCannon I

495.description:
Powerful, intermediate-range repeating autocannon with a decent rate of fire. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
495.name: Dual 650mm Repeating Cannon I

496.description:
A two-barreled, intermediate-range, powerful cannon capable of causing tremendous damage. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
496.name: 800mm Repeating Cannon I

497.description:
One of the most powerful projectile cannons a battleship can equip. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
497.name: 1200mm Artillery Cannon I

498.description:
The ultimate artillery cannon. It hurls death and destruction over incredible distances. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
498.name: 1400mm Howitzer Artillery I

499.description: Favored by many for its average capacity and firing rate. Useful in both fast attack raids and longer battles.
499.name: Light Missile Launcher I

501.description: Designed for long engagements between medium sized ships. Slow firing rate, but makes up for it with a large missile capacity.
501.name: Heavy Missile Launcher I

503.description: A massive launcher designed for extended bombardments of hard targets like battleships and stations. Contains a huge missile capacity, but has a slow firing rate and trouble targeting small, fast ships.
503.name: Torpedo Launcher I

519.description:
Gives a bonus to the speed and damage of projectile turrets. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
519.name: Gyrostabilizer II

520.description:
Gives a bonus to the speed and damage of projectile turrets. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
520.name: Gyrostabilizer I

523.description: This module uses nano-assemblers to repair damage done to the armor of the ship.
523.name: Small Armor Repairer I

524.description: Makes use of nano-assembler technology in order to repair damage done to the structure.
524.name: Small Hull Repairer I

526.description: Reduces the maximum speed of a ship by employing micro energy streams which effectively entangle the target temporarily, thereby slowing it down.
526.name: Stasis Webifier I

527.description: Reduces the maximum speed of a ship by employing micro energy streams which effectively entangle the target temporarily, thereby slowing it down.
527.name: Stasis Webifier II

529.description: Transfers capacitor energy to another ship.
529.name: Small Remote Capacitor Transmitter I

530.description:
Drains energy from the target ship and adds it to your own.

Note: A Nosferatu module will not drain your target's capacitor below your own capacitor level.
530.name: Small Energy Nosferatu I

533.description: Neutralizes a portion of the energy in the target ship's capacitor.
533.name: Small Energy Neutralizer I

561.description:
A small multi-barreled railgun for frigates. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
561.name: 75mm Gatling Rail I

562.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
562.name: Light Electron Blaster I

563.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
563.name: Light Ion Blaster I

564.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
564.name: Light Neutron Blaster I

565.description:
This is a standard long-range railgun designed for frigates. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
565.name: 150mm Railgun I

566.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
566.name: Heavy Electron Blaster I

567.description:
This cruiser-sized weapon is a double-barreled version of the frigate class 150mm railgun. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
567.name: Dual 150mm Railgun I

568.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
568.name: Heavy Neutron Blaster I

569.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
569.name: Heavy Ion Blaster I

570.description:
Cruiser-sized large barrel turret. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
570.name: 250mm Railgun I

571.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
571.name: Electron Blaster Cannon I

572.description:
This battleship-sized weapon is a double-barreled version of the cruiser class 250mm railgun. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
572.name: Dual 250mm Railgun I

573.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
573.name: Neutron Blaster Cannon I

574.description:
This large battleship-sized weapon packs quite a punch. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
574.name: 425mm Railgun I

575.description:
Particle blasters operate on a similar principle as the railgun except they fire a magnetically contained ball of subatomic particles. No other turret class can match the sheer destructive power of particle blasters, but due to the rapid dispersion of the containment field, it also has the worst range of all turrets. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
575.name: Ion Blaster Cannon I

577.description: Provides a quick injection of power into the capacitor.
577.name: Medium Capacitor Booster I

578.description:
Boosts shield resistance against all damage types.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module, or similar modules that affect the same resistance type, will result in a penalty to the boost you get on that type of resistance.
578.name: Multispectrum Shield Hardener I

580.description:
Emits random electronic bursts which have a chance of momentarily disrupting target locks on ships within range.

This module can be equipped to Battleship, Marauder, Black Ops, Command Ship, Hauler, Blockade Runner, and Deep Space Transport ships.

Note: Only one module of this type can be activated at the same time. Additionally, fitting a Burst Jammer module will disable interdiction nullification.
580.name: Burst Jammer I

581.description: Uses advanced gravitational and visual targeting to identify threats. Allows target lock without alerting the ship to a possible threat.
581.name: Passive Targeter I

582.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. In the Caldari State, this led to the redesign and redeployment of the Bantam.

The Bantam, a strong and sturdy craft, was originally an extremely effective mining frigate. After its redesign, the Bantam's large structure had to give way for logistics systems that ate up some of its interior room but allowed it to focus extensively on shield support for fellow vessels.
582.name: Bantam

583.description: The Condor is fast and agile. It has limited cargo space so it's not very suitable for trading or mining. It is best used as an assault vessel in a hit-and-run type of operations.
583.name: Condor

584.description: The Griffin is much used by the Caldari Navy as a support vessel in combat squadrons, using its impressive array of electronic gadgetry to disrupt the operation of target ships, making them easy prey for traditional combat vessels.
584.name: Griffin

585.description: The Slasher is cheap, but versatile. It's been manufactured en masse, making it one of the most common vessels in Minmatar space. The Slasher is extremely fast, with decent armaments, and is popular amongst budding pirates and smugglers.
585.name: Slasher

586.description: The Probe is large compared to most Minmatar frigates and is considered a good scout and cargo-runner. Uncharacteristically for a Minmatar ship, its hard outer coating makes it difficult to destroy, while the limited weapon hardpoints force it to rely on drone assistance if engaged in combat.
586.name: Probe

587.description: The Rifter is a very powerful combat frigate and can easily tackle the best frigates out there. It has gone through many radical design phases since its inauguration during the Minmatar Rebellion. The Rifter has a wide variety of offensive capabilities, making it an unpredictable and deadly adversary.
587.name: Rifter

589.description: The Executioner is another newly commissioned ship of the Amarr Imperial Navy. The Executioner was designed specially to counter the small, fast raider frigates of the Minmatar Republic; thus it is different from most Amarr ships in favoring speed over defenses. With the Executioner, the Amarrians have expanded their tactical capabilities on the battlefield.
589.name: Executioner

590.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. In the Amarr Empire, this led to the redesign and redeployment of the Inquisitor.

The Inquisitor was originally an example of how the Amarr Imperial Navy modeled their design to counter specific tactics employed by the other empires. After its redesign, it was exclusively devoted to the role of a support frigate, and its formerly renowned missile capabilities gave way to a focus on remote armor repair.
590.name: Inquisitor

591.description: The Tormentor has been in service for many decades. For most of that time it saw service as a mining ship, its size barring it from making any kind of impact on the battlefield. As with most Amarr ships, however, its strong defenses always made it a tough opponent to crack, and with recent advances in turret capacitor use and damage output, its lasers have now stopped digging into dead ore and are instead focused on boring through the hulls of hapless vessels in combat.
591.name: Tormentor

592.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. In the Gallente Federation, this led to the redesign and redeployment of the Navitas.

The Navitas had been a solid mining vessel that had seen wide use by independent excavators, along with being one of the best ships available for budding traders and even for much-maligned scavengers. After its redesign, its long-range scanners and sturdy outer shell gave way entirely for remote repairing capabilities, moving the Navitas away from the calming buzz of mining lasers and into the roar of battle.
592.name: Navitas

593.description: Often nicknamed The Fat Man this nimble little frigate is mainly used by the Federation in escort duties or on short-range patrols. The Tristan has been very popular throughout Gallente space for years because of its versatility. It is rather expensive, but buyers will definitely get their money's worth, as the Tristan is one of the more powerful frigates available on the market.
593.name: Tristan

594.description: The Incursus may be found both spearheading and bulwarking Gallente military operations. Its speed makes it excellent for skirmishing duties, while its resilience helps it outlast its opponents on the battlefield. Incursus-class ships move together in groups and can quickly and effectively gang up on ships many times their size and overwhelm them. In recent years the Incursus has increasingly found its way into the hands of pirates, who love its aggressive appearance.
594.name: Incursus

597.description: The Punisher is considered by many to be one of the best Amarr frigates in existence. As evidenced by its heavy armaments, the Punisher is mainly intended for large-scale military operations, acting in coordination with larger military vessels. With its damage output, however, it is also perfectly capable of punching its way right through unwary opponents.
597.name: Punisher

598.description: The Breacher's structure is little more than a fragile scrapheap, but the ship's missile launcher hardpoints and superior sensors have placed it among the most valued Minmatar frigates when it comes to long range combat.
598.name: Breacher

599.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. In the Minmatar Republic, this led to the redesign and redeployment of the Burst.

The Burst had been a small and fast cargo vessel. This all changed after the redesign, when the Burst found its small-time mining capabilities curtailed in lieu of logistics systems that moved its focus to shield support for friendly vessels.
599.name: Burst

602.description: The Kestrel is a heavy missile boat with one of the most sophisticated sensor arrays around. Interestingly enough, it has been used by both the Caldari Navy and several wealthy trade corporations as a cargo-hauling vessel. It is one of few trading vessels with good punching power, making it ideal for solo trade-runs in dangerous areas. The Kestrel was designed so that it could take up to four missile launchers but as a result it can not be equipped with turret weapons nor with mining lasers.
602.name: Kestrel

603.description: The Merlin is the most powerful combat frigate of the Caldari. Its role has evolved through the years, and while its defenses have always remained exceptionally strong for a Caldari vessel, its offensive capabilities have evolved from versatile, jack-of-all-trades attack patterns into focused and deadly gunfire tactics. The Merlin's primary aim is to have its turrets punch holes in opponents' hulls.
603.name: Merlin

605.description: The Heron has good computer and electronic systems, giving it the option of participating in electronic warfare. But it has relatively poor defenses and limited weaponry, so it's more commonly used for scouting and exploration.
605.name: Heron

607.description: The Imicus is a slow but hard-shelled frigate, ideal for any type of scouting activity. Used by merchant, miner and combat groups, the Imicus is usually relied upon as the operation's eyes and ears when traversing low security sectors.
607.name: Imicus

608.description: The Atron is a hard nugget with an advanced power conduit system, but little space for cargo. Although it is a good harvester when it comes to mining, its main ability is as a combat vessel.
608.name: Atron

609.description: The Maulus is a high-tech vessel, specialized for electronic warfare. It is particularly valued in fleet warfare due to its optimization for sensor dampening technology.
609.name: Maulus

614.description: The Fury is a fast and versatile frigate. Its primary role is as a tackler, getting in close and holding down the enemies of the Angel Cartel. It backs up this with decent armaments and is rarely alone.
614.name: Fury

615.description: The Immolator is a small ship, designed by the upper (read: unslaved) echelon of Sansha's Nation to serve as a good entry for those pilots new to the glory of Nation. It excels in picking off smaller targets and hitting them hard with energy beams.
615.name: Immolator

616.description: The Medusa is the Angel Cartels premier Frigate class Electronic Warfare platform. It's fast and agile, allowing it to keep the distance needed to avoid enemy fire while providing a range of electronic warfare support.
616.name: Medusa

617.description: The Echo is a small vessel, designed by the Angel Cartel to be easily missed in the heat of battle, while posing a viable threat in combat. As such, it is intended to rush in with guns blazing and subsequently escape without being eaten up by larger ships.
617.name: Echo

618.description: Little is known about the Lynx. The Angel Cartel uses it for a variety of roles including close range electronic warfare support, as well as dishing out significant damage from its projectile weapon systems.
618.name: Lynx

619.description: The Swordspine is a logistics frigate operated by the Angel Cartel. It's remote shield boosters have saved many an Angel pilot, and lead to the downfall of countless capsuleers.
619.name: Swordspine

620.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. Both Frigate and Cruiser-class ships were put under the microscope, and in the Caldari State the outcome of the re-evaluation process led, among other developments, to a redesign and redeployment of the Osprey.

The Osprey originally offered excellent versatility and power for what was considered a comparably low price. After its redesign, its inbuilt mining technology - now a little creaky and long in the tooth - was gutted from the Osprey and replaced in its entirety with tech of a different type, capable of high energy and shield transfers.
620.name: Osprey

621.description: The Caracal is a powerful vessel that specializes in missile deployment. It has excellent shield defenses, but poor armor plating. Its missile arsenal, when fully stocked, is capable of making mincemeat of almost anyone.
621.name: Caracal

622.description: The Stabber is the mainstay of the Minmatar fleet. It is light and extremely fast, yet surprisingly powerful, with a wide variety of weapons.
622.name: Stabber

623.description: The Moa was designed as an all-out combat ship, and its heavy armament allows the Moa to tackle almost anything that floats in space. In contrast to its nemesis the Thorax, the Moa is most effective at long range where its railguns can rain death upon foes.
623.name: Moa

624.description: Quite possibly the toughest cruiser in the galaxy, the Maller is a common sight in Amarrian Imperial Navy operations. It is mainly used for military duty, although a few can be found in the private sector acting as escort ships for very important dispatches.
624.name: Maller

625.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. Both Frigate and Cruiser-class ships were put under the microscope, and in the Amarr Empire the outcome of the re-evaluation process led, among other developments, to a redesign and redeployment of the Augoror.

The Augoror-class cruiser is one of the old warhorses of the Amarr Empire, having seen action in both the Jovian War and the Minmatar Rebellion. Like most Amarr vessels, the Augoror depended first and foremost on its resilience and heavy armor to escape unscathed from unfriendly encounters. After its overhaul, it had some of the armor stripped off to make room for equipment allowing it to focus on the armor of other vessels, along with energy transfers.
625.name: Augoror

626.description: The Vexor is a strong combat ship that is also geared to operate in a variety of other roles. The Vexor is especially useful for surveying in potentially hostile sectors as it can stay on duty for a very long time before having to return to base. Furthermore, it is well capable of defending itself against even concentrated attacks.
626.name: Vexor

627.description: The Thorax-class cruiser is the latest combat ship commissioned by the Federation. While the Thorax is a very effective ship at any range, typical of modern Gallente design philosophy it is most effective when working at extreme close range where its blasters and hordes of combat drones tear through even the toughest of enemies.
627.name: Thorax

628.description: The Arbitrator is unusual for Amarr ships in that it's primarily a drone carrier. While it is not the best carrier around, it has superior armor that gives it greater durability than most ships in its class.
628.name: Arbitrator

629.description: The Rupture is slow for a Minmatar ship, but it more than makes up for it in power. The Rupture has superior firepower and is used by the Minmatar Republic both to defend space stations and other stationary objects and as part of massive attack formations.
629.name: Rupture

630.description: Being a highly versatile class of Minmatar ships, the Bellicose has been used as a combat juggernaut as well as a support ship for wings of frigates. While not quite in the league of newer navy cruisers, the Bellicose is still a very solid ship for most purposes, especially in terms of long range combat.
630.name: Bellicose

631.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. Both Frigate and Cruiser-class ships were put under the microscope, and in the Minmatar Republic the outcome of the re-evaluation process led, among other developments, to a redesign and redeployment of the Scythe.

The Scythe-class cruiser remains the oldest Minmatar ship still in use. It has seen many battles and is an integrated part in Minmatar tales and heritage. With its redesign, past firmware upgrades for mining output were tossed out entirely in favor of two new separate systems that focused on shield transporting and logistics drones respectively.
631.name: Scythe

632.description: The Blackbird is a small high-tech cruiser newly employed by the Caldari Navy. Commonly seen in fleet battles or acting as wingman, it is not intended for head-on slugfests, but rather delicate tactical situations.
632.name: Blackbird

633.description: The Celestis cruiser is a versatile ship which can be employed in a myriad of roles, making it handy for small corporations with a limited number of ships. True to Gallente style the Celestis is especially deadly in close quarters combat due to its advanced targeting systems.
633.name: Celestis

634.description:
In YC114 each major empire faction, having been embroiled in a harrowing, extensive, long-term war, recognized the growing need for support and logistics functionality in their vessels during the kind of protracted interstellar warfare that might otherwise prove exhausting for its participants. Both Frigate and Cruiser-class ships were put under the microscope, and in the Gallente Federation the outcome of the re-evaluation process led, among other developments, to a redesign and redeployment of the Exequror.

The Exequror was a heavy cargo cruiser originally strong enough to defend itself against raiding frigates, though it lacked prowess in heavier combat situations. After its redesign, it had some of that bulk - and, necessarily, some of that strength - yanked out and replaced with the capability to help others in heavy combat situations, in particular those who needed armor repairs.
634.name: Exequror

638.description: The Raven is the powerhouse of the Caldari Navy. With its myriad launcher slots and powerful shields, few ships can rival it in strength or majesty.
638.name: Raven

639.description: The Tempest is one of the Republic Fleet's key vessels; a versatile gunship proficient at long-range bombardment and capable of dishing out specialized types of damage with great effectiveness. A well-rounded squadron of Tempests has been proven time and time again to be an invaluable wild card in a fleet battle, one which opponents should ignore at their own peril.
639.name: Tempest

640.description: The first Scorpion-class battleship was launched only a couple of years ago, and those that have been built are considered to be prototypes. Little is known of its capabilities, but what has been garnered suggests that the Scorpion is crammed to the brink with sophisticated hi-tech equipment that few can match.
640.name: Scorpion

641.description: The Megathron has established itself as one of the most feared and respected battleships around. Since its first appearance almost two decades ago it has seen considerable service in the troublesome regions on the outskirts of the Federation, helping to expand and defend Gallentean influence there.
641.name: Megathron

642.description: In days past, only those in high favor with the Emperor could hope to earn the reward of commanding one of the majestic and powerful Apocalypse class battleships. In latter years, even though now in full market circulation, these golden, metallic monstrosities are still feared and respected as enduring symbols of Amarrian might.
642.name: Apocalypse

643.description: The mighty Armageddon class is one of the enduring warhorses of the Amarr Empire. Once a juggernaut that steamrolled its way into battle, it has now taken on a more stately and calculated approach, sending out a web of drones in its place while it drains the enemy from a distance.
643.name: Armageddon

644.description: Much praised by its proponents and much maligned by its detractors, the Typhoon-class battleship has always been one of the most hotly debated spacefaring vessels around. Its distinguishing aspect - and the source of most of the controversy - is its sheer versatility, variously seen as either a lack of design focus or a deliberate freedom for pilot modification.
644.name: Typhoon

645.description: The Dominix is one of the old warhorses dating back to the Gallente-Caldari War. While no longer regarded as the king of the hill, it is by no means obsolete. Its formidable hulk and powerful drone arsenal means that anyone not in the largest and latest battleships will regret ever locking horns with it.
645.name: Dominix

648.description: The Badger-class hauler is the main light cargo-carrier for the Caldari State, particularly for long, arduous trade runs. Its large size and flexible defenses make it perfectly equipped for those tasks, although the Caldari seldom let it roam alone.
648.name: Badger

649.description: The Tayra, an evolution of the old Badger Mark II hauler, focuses entirely on reaching the highest potential capacity that Caldari engineers can manage in a standard cargo carrier.
649.name: Tayra

650.description: Originally set to sail under the guise of "Iteron", this new iteration of an old and stalwart hauler is fast and reliable. It is equally popular among civilians and militaries due to its low price and ability to be fitted in myriad different ways. Despite its speed and resilience, however, it may need to be guarded while in particularly unfriendly territories, which is why it has also been outfitted with a drone bay for extra protection.
650.name: Nereus

651.description: Aside from being endowed with the usual carrying capabilities of haulers, the Hoarder possesses an extra cargo bay. That bay is a static-free, blast-proof chamber, and as such is meant to be dedicated solely to ferrying consumable charges of all kinds, including ammunition, missiles, capacitor charges, nanite paste and bombs.
651.name: Hoarder

652.description: The Mammoth is the largest hauler in the Minmatar Republic's light cargo ship fleets. It was designed with aid from the Gallente Federation, making the Mammoth both large and powerful yet also nimble and technologically advanced. A very good buy.
652.name: Mammoth

653.description: The Wreathe is an old hauler of the Minmatar Republic and one of the oldest ship designs still in use. The design of the Wreathe is very plain, which is the main reason for its longevity, but it also makes the ship incapable of handling anything but the most mundane tasks.
653.name: Wreathe

654.description:
Aside from being endowed with the usual hauling capabilities of haulers, the Kryos possesses two extra cargo bays. They are both equipped with precise temperature and pressure controls; the first is celebrated specifically for ferrying minerals, while the second is calibrated at the extremely low temperatures required for harvested cosmic ice. 

The Kryos was originally designed as a variant of the Iteron, but eventually evolved to perform an entirely separate role.
654.name: Kryos

655.description: Aside from being endowed with the usual carrying capabilities of haulers, the Epithal possesses an extra cargo bay. That bay is equipped with sealed sub-chambers capable of maintaining hospitable environments for practically any kind of organism or entity, from biocells to viral agents, and is meant solely for ferrying planetary commodities. The Epithal was originally designed as a variant of the Iteron, but eventually evolved to perform an entirely separate role.
655.name: Epithal

656.description: Aside from being endowed with the usual carrying capabilities of haulers, the Miasmos possesses an extra cargo bay. That bay is equipped with sealed, temperature-controlled vats, and is meant solely for ferrying all types of interstellar ore: ice, gasses and asteroids. The Miasmos was originally designed as a variant of the Iteron, but eventually evolved to perform an entirely separate role.
656.name: Miasmos

657.description: This lumbering giant is the latest and last iteration in a chain of haulers. It is the only one to retain the original "Iteron"-class callsign, but while all the others eventually evolved into specialized versions, the Iteron Mk. V still does what haulers do best: Transporting enormous amounts of goods and commodities between the stars.
657.name: Iteron Mark V

671.description: From the formless void's gaping maw, there springs an entity. Not an entity such as any you can conceive of, nor I; an entity more primordial than the elements themselves, yet constantly coming into existence even as it is destroyed. It is the Child of Chaos, the Pathway to the Next. The darkness shall swallow the land, and in its wake there will follow a storm, as the appetite of nothing expands over the world. From the formless void's gaping maw, there springs an entity. -Dr. Damella Macaper, The Seven Events of the Apocalypse
671.name: Erebus

1182.description: Targets any hostile ship within range on activation. Grants a +2 bonus to ship's max targets when online.
1182.name: Auto Targeting System I

1183.description: This module uses nano-assemblers to repair damage done to the armor of the ship.
1183.name: Small Armor Repairer II

1185.description: Increases capacitor storage. Provides defense against Energy Leech and Energy Neutralizer effects.
1185.name: Small Cap Battery I

1190.description: Transfers capacitor energy to another ship.
1190.name: Small Remote Capacitor Transmitter II

1197.description:
An array of microscopic reactive prisms that disperse electromagnetic radiation. Grants a bonus to armor EM damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1197.name: EM Coating I

1198.description:
An array of microscopic reactive prisms that disperse electromagnetic radiation. Grants a bonus to armor EM damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1198.name: EM Coating II

1223.description:
Bistot is a very valuable ore as it holds large portions of Zydrine and Pyerite. It also contains a decent amount of Mexallon.

Available primarily in null security status and wormhole systems.
1223.name: Bistot

1224.description:
Pyroxeres is a common ore available in all regions of space. It has fair amounts of Pyerite and Mexallon.

Available in all known space and wormhole systems.
1224.name: Pyroxeres

1225.description:
Crokite is a very heavy ore that is always in high demand because it has the largest ratio of Nocxium and Mexallon for any ore in the known universe. Valuable deposits of Pyerite can also be found within this rare ore.

Available primarily in low security status star systems.
1225.name: Crokite

1226.description:
Jaspet has two valuable mineral types, making it easy to sell. It has a large portion of Mexallon plus some Nocxium.

Available primarily in low security status star systems.
1226.name: Jaspet

1227.description:
Omber is a common ore that is still an excellent ore for novice miners as it has a sizeable portion of Isogen, as well as some Pyerite. A few trips of mining this and a novice is quick to rise in status.

Available primarily in low security status and wormhole systems.
1227.name: Omber

1228.description:
Scordite is amongst the most common ore types in the central regions of known universe. It has a fair bit of Tritanium and Pyerite. Good choice for those starting their mining careers.

Available primarily in high security status star systems.
1228.name: Scordite

1229.description:
Gneiss is a popular ore type because it holds significant volumes of three heavily used minerals, increasing its utility value. It has quite a bit of Mexallon as well as some Pyerite and Isogen.

Available primarily in low security status and wormhole systems.
1229.name: Gneiss

1230.description:
Veldspar is the most common ore type in the central regions of known universe. It is still in constant demand as it holds a large portion of the much-used Tritanium mineral.

Available primarily in high security status star systems.
1230.name: Veldspar

1231.description:
With a large portion of Nocxium, hemorphite is always a good find. It is common enough that even novice miners can expect to run into it. Hemorphite also has some amount of Isogen.

Available primarily in low security status star systems.
1231.name: Hemorphite

1232.description:
Considered a worthless ore for years, dark ochre was ignored by most miners until improved reprocessing techniques managed to extract the huge amount of Isogen and Mexallon inside it. Dark ochre also contains useful amounts of Nocxium.

Available primarily in low security status star systems.
1232.name: Dark Ochre

1236.description:
This monster unit vastly increases engine power at the expense of cargo capacity.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1236.name: Overdrive Injector System II

1244.description:
This monster unit vastly increases engine power at the expense of cargo capacity.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1244.name: Overdrive Injector System I

1246.description: Increases capacitor recharge rate, but causes a reduction in maximum capacitor storage.
1246.name: Capacitor Flux Coil I

1248.description: Increases capacitor recharge rate, but causes a reduction in maximum capacitor storage.
1248.name: Capacitor Flux Coil II

1254.description: Increases shield recharge rate while lowering the maximum shield capacity.
1254.name: Shield Flux Coil I

1256.description: Increases shield recharge rate while lowering the maximum shield capacity.
1256.name: Shield Flux Coil II

1264.description:
This coating is composed of an array of microscopic reactive bombs that are exploded to counter explosive damage. Grants a bonus to armor explosive damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1264.name: Explosive Coating I

1266.description:
This coating is composed of an array of microscopic reactive bombs that are exploded to counter explosive damage. Grants a bonus to armor explosive damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1266.name: Explosive Coating II

1274.description: This coating is composed of several layers, effectively increasing the armor hit points.
1274.name: Layered Coating I

1276.description: This coating is composed of several layers, effectively increasing the armor hit points.
1276.name: Layered Coating II

1284.description:
This coating utilizes a magnetic field to deflect kinetic attacks. Grants a bonus to armor kinetic damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1284.name: Kinetic Coating I

1286.description:
This coating utilizes a magnetic field to deflect kinetic attacks. Grants a bonus to armor kinetic damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1286.name: Kinetic Coating II

1294.description:
This coating allows for faster dispersion of heat from the area of impact. Grants a bonus to armor thermal damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1294.name: Thermal Coating I

1296.description:
This coating allows for faster dispersion of heat from the area of impact. Grants a bonus to armor thermal damage resistance.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1296.name: Thermal Coating II

1304.description:
This version of armor coating increases the armor protection against all types of damage, however it is less effective than coatings tuned against a specific damage profile.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1304.name: Multispectrum Coating I

1306.description:
This version of armor coating increases the armor protection against all types of damage, however it is less effective than coatings tuned against a specific damage profile.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1306.name: Multispectrum Coating II

1317.description: Increases cargo hold capacity at the expense of maximum velocity and hull strength.
1317.name: Expanded Cargohold I

1319.description: Increases cargo hold capacity at the expense of maximum velocity and hull strength.
1319.name: Expanded Cargohold II

1333.description: Increases structural hit points while reducing agility and cargo capacity.
1333.name: Reinforced Bulkheads I

1335.description: Increases structural hit points while reducing agility and cargo capacity.
1335.name: Reinforced Bulkheads II

1403.description:
Improves ship handling and maneuverability.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1403.name: Inertial Stabilizers I

1405.description:
Improves ship handling and maneuverability.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1405.name: Inertial Stabilizers II

1422.description: Diverts power from the capacitors to the shields, thereby increasing the shield recharge rate.
1422.name: Shield Power Relay II

1436.description: Targets any hostile ship within range on activation. Grants a +3 bonus to ship's max targets when online.
1436.name: Auto Targeting System II

1445.description: Increases capacitor recharge rate at the expense of shield boosting.
1445.name: Capacitor Power Relay I

1447.description: Increases capacitor recharge rate at the expense of shield boosting.
1447.name: Capacitor Power Relay II

1539.description: Monitors and optimizes the power grid. Gives a slight boost to power core output and a minor increase in shield and capacitor recharge rate.
1539.name: Power Diagnostic System I

1541.description: Monitors and optimizes the power grid. Gives a slight boost to power core output and a minor increase in shield and capacitor recharge rate.
1541.name: Power Diagnostic System II

1547.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes explosive damage to surrounding vessels.
1547.name: Small Proton Smartbomb I

1549.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes explosive damage to surrounding vessels.
1549.name: Small Proton Smartbomb II

1551.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes kinetic damage to surrounding vessels.
1551.name: Small Graviton Smartbomb I

1553.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes kinetic damage to surrounding vessels.
1553.name: Small Graviton Smartbomb II

1557.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes thermal damage to surrounding vessels.
1557.name: Small Plasma Smartbomb I

1559.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes thermal damage to surrounding vessels.
1559.name: Small Plasma Smartbomb II

1563.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes EM damage to surrounding vessels.
1563.name: Small EMP Smartbomb I

1565.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes EM damage to surrounding vessels.
1565.name: Small EMP Smartbomb II

1808.description:
Boosts the EM resistance of the shield.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1808.name: EM Shield Amplifier I

1810.description: A Caldarian light missile with a graviton warhead and automatic guidance system.
1810.name: Scourge Auto-Targeting Light Missile I

1814.description: A Minmatar light missile with a nuclear warhead and automatic guidance system.
1814.name: Nova Auto-Targeting Light Missile I

1816.description: A Gallente light missile with a plasma warhead and automatic guidance system.
1816.name: Inferno Auto-Targeting Light Missile I

1818.description: A Caldarian heavy missile with a graviton warhead and automatic guidance system.
1818.name: Scourge Auto-Targeting Heavy Missile I

1820.description: An Amarr heavy missile with an EMP warhead and automatic guidance system.
1820.name: Mjolnir Auto-Targeting Heavy Missile I

1822.description: A Minmatar heavy missile with a nuclear warhead and automatic guidance system.
1822.name: Nova Auto-Targeting Heavy Missile I

1824.description: A Gallente heavy missile with a plasma warhead and automatic guidance system.
1824.name: Inferno Auto-Targeting Heavy Missile I

1826.description: A Caldarian cruise missile with a graviton warhead and automatic guidance system.
1826.name: Scourge Auto-Targeting Cruise Missile I

1828.description: An Amarr cruise missile with an EMP warhead and automatic guidance system.
1828.name: Mjolnir Auto-Targeting Cruise Missile I

1830.description: A Minmatar cruise missile with a nuclear warhead and automatic guidance system.
1830.name: Nova Auto-Targeting Cruise Missile I

1832.description: A Gallente cruise missile with a plasma warhead and automatic guidance system
1832.name: Inferno Auto-Targeting Cruise Missile I

1855.description: Scans the target ship and provides a tactical analysis of its capabilities. The further it goes beyond scan range, the more inaccurate its results will be.
1855.name: Ship Scanner II

1875.description: Launcher for cruisers intended to counter fast frigates, can only be fitted with regular light missiles.
1875.name: Rapid Light Missile Launcher I

1877.description: Launcher for cruisers intended to counter fast frigates, can only be fitted with regular and advanced light missiles.
1877.name: Rapid Light Missile Launcher II

1944.description: The Bestower has for decades been used by the Empire as a slave transport, shipping human labor between cultivated planets in Imperial space. As a proof to how reliable this class has been through the years, the Emperor has used an upgraded version of this very same class as transports for the Imperial Treasury. The Bestower has very thick armor and large cargo space.
1944.name: Bestower

1947.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1947.name: ECCM - Radar I

1948.description: Projects a low intensity field of ionized particles to disrupt the effectiveness of enemy sensors. Very effective against the Magnetometric-based sensors used by Gallente, Serpentis, ORE and SoE ships.
1948.name: Magnetometric ECM I

1952.description:
Gives an increase to targeting range, scan resolution and sensor strength. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas.  

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1952.name: Sensor Booster II

1955.description: Projects random bursts of gravitons that disrupt accurate targeting. As expected this system works best against Gravimetric targeting systems such as those found on Caldari, Guristas and Mordu's Legion ships.
1955.name: Gravimetric ECM I

1956.description: Disrupts enemy targeting by generating a field of random sensor noise. Works especially well against the Radar systems incorporated into ships built by the Amarr, Blood Raiders, Sansha's Nation and Triglavian Collective.
1956.name: Radar ECM I

1957.description: An advanced multipurpose jamming system designed to offer blanket protection against all forms of targeting. Not as effective as the more specialized systems but is still effective against less advanced targeting systems.
1957.name: Multispectral ECM I

1958.description: Analyzes incoming targeting signals and attempts to counter them by emitting an out-of-phase signal back. Great against Ladar targeting systems such as those found on Minmatar and Angel Cartel ships.
1958.name: Ladar ECM I

1959.description:
ECCM Projectors utilize a sophisticated system of electronics to fortify the sensor strengths of an allied ship allowing it to overcome jamming.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1959.name: ECCM Projector I

1960.description:
ECCM Projectors utilize a sophisticated system of electronics to fortify the sensor strengths of an allied ship allowing it to overcome jamming.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1960.name: ECCM Projector II

1963.description:
Can only be activated on targets to increase their scan resolutions, boost their targeting range and improve their sensor strength. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1963.name: Remote Sensor Booster I

1964.description:
Can only be activated on targets to increase their scan resolutions, boost their targeting range and improve their sensor strength. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1964.name: Remote Sensor Booster II

1968.description:
Reduces the range and speed of a targeted ship's sensors. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1968.name: Remote Sensor Dampener I

1969.description:
Reduces the range and speed of a targeted ship's sensors. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1969.name: Remote Sensor Dampener II

1973.description:
Gives an increase to targeting range, scan resolution and sensor strength. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas.  

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1973.name: Sensor Booster I

1977.description:
By predicting the trajectory of targets, it helps to boost the tracking speed and range of turrets. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1977.name: Tracking Computer I

1978.description:
By predicting the trajectory of targets, it helps to boost the tracking speed and range of turrets. This module can be loaded with scripts to increase its effectiveness in certain areas. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1978.name: Tracking Computer II

1986.description:
Augments the sensor and electronics suite of the fitted ship. Benefits include additional locked targets, increased maximum target acquisition range, faster locking speed, and increased sensor strength.
Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1986.name: Signal Amplifier I

1987.description:
Augments the sensor and electronics suite of the fitted ship. Benefits include additional locked targets, increased maximum target acquisition range, faster locking speed, and increased sensor strength.
Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1987.name: Signal Amplifier II

1998.description:
Enhances the range and improves the tracking speed of turrets.    

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1998.name: Tracking Enhancer I

1999.description:
Enhances the range and improves the tracking speed of turrets.    

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
1999.name: Tracking Enhancer II

2001.description:
This is a deprecated item, and though it still functions there are plans for it to be removed from circulation in the future.

This upgrade allows the onlining of a Standup Cynosural System Jammer at one Tenebrex Cyno Jammer structure in the same solar system.
2001.name: Deprecated Cynosural Suppression

2002.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
2002.name: ECCM - Ladar I

2003.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
2003.name: ECCM - Magnetometric I

2004.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
2004.name: ECCM - Gravimetric I

2005.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
2005.name: ECCM - Omni I

2006.description: The Omen is a stereotypical example of the Amarrian School of thinking when it comes to ship design: thick armor and hard hitting lasers. Advancements in heat dissipation allow the Omen to fire its lasers faster than other ships without this technology.
2006.name: Omen

2008.description:
This is a deprecated item, and though it still functions there are plans for it to be removed from circulation in the future.

This upgrade allows the onlining of a Standup Cynosural Field Generator at one Pharolux Cyno Beacon structure in the same solar system.
2008.name: Deprecated Cynosural Navigation

2009.description:
This is a deprecated item, and though it still functions there are plans for it to be removed from circulation in the future.

This upgrade allows the onlining of Standup Supercapital Shipyards at any Sotiyo-class Engineering Complexes in the solar system.
2009.name: Deprecated Supercapital Construction Facilities

2018.name: Medium Cap Battery I

2020.description: Increases capacitor storage. Provides defense against Energy Leech and Energy Neutralizer effects.
2020.name: Large Cap Battery I

2022.description: Increases capacitor storage. Provides defense against Energy Leech and Energy Neutralizer effects.
2022.name: X-Large Capacitor Battery I

2024.description: Provides a quick injection of power into the capacitor.
2024.name: Medium Capacitor Booster II

This is a deprecated item, and though it still functions there are plans for it to be removed from circulation in the future.

Utilizes a combination of containment field emitters and redundancy systems to mitigate the impact of critical system damage. 

Grants a bonus to resistance for shield, armor and hull.

Only one Damage Control can be fit at a given time.
2046.name: Damage Control I

Utilizes a combination of containment field emitters and redundancy systems to mitigate the impact of critical system damage.

Only one Damage Control can be fit at a given time.
