Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18052.name: Kernite Mining Crystal I

18054.description:
A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Mercoxit yield.

Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.

Type A crystals are used with modulated mining equipment and provide steady yields, with low residues and high reliability. A crystal choice for methodical mining operations prioritizing resource utilization over time.
18054.name: Mercoxit Asteroid Mining Crystal Type A I

18056.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Omber yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18056.name: Omber Mining Crystal I

18058.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Plagioclase yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18058.name: Plagioclase Mining Crystal I

18060.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Pyroxeres yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18060.name: Pyroxeres Mining Crystal I

18062.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Scordite yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18062.name: Scordite Mining Crystal I

18064.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Spodumain yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18064.name: Spodumain Mining Crystal I

18066.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Veldspar yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18066.name: Veldspar Mining Crystal I

18068.description:
The modulated deep core miner is a technological marvel that combines the capacities of the commonly used Miner II with that of the deep core mining laser. Using a modular mining crystal system, it can be altered on the fly for maximum efficiency.

It's important to remember, however, that without the proper crystals this unit is only marginally useful for mining mercoxit, and highly inefficient for most anything else.
18068.name: Modulated Deep Core Miner II

18590.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Arkonor yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18590.name: Arkonor Mining Crystal II

18592.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Bistot yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18592.name: Bistot Mining Crystal II

18594.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Crokite yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18594.name: Crokite Mining Crystal II

18596.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Dark Ochre yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18596.name: Dark Ochre Mining Crystal II

18598.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Gneiss yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18598.name: Gneiss Mining Crystal II

18600.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Hedbergite yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18600.name: Hedbergite Mining Crystal II

18602.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Hemorphite yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18602.name: Hemorphite Mining Crystal II

18604.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Jaspet yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18604.name: Jaspet Mining Crystal II

18606.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Kernite yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18606.name: Kernite Mining Crystal II

18608.description:
An advanced custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Mercoxit yield.

Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.

Type A crystals are used with modulated mining equipment and provide steady yields, with low residues and high reliability. A crystal choice for methodical mining operations prioritizing resource utilization over time.
18608.name: Mercoxit Asteroid Mining Crystal Type A II

18610.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Omber yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18610.name: Omber Mining Crystal II

18612.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Plagioclase yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18612.name: Plagioclase Mining Crystal II

18614.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Pyroxeres yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18614.name: Pyroxeres Mining Crystal II

18616.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Scordite yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18616.name: Scordite Mining Crystal II

18618.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Veldspar yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18618.name: Veldspar Mining Crystal II

18624.description: A custom-cut frequency crystal whose refractive qualities are specifically suited to boosting Spodumain yield. Due to their molecular make-up and the strength of the modulated miner's beam, these crystals will deteriorate through extended use. Can be loaded into modulated mining lasers only.
18624.name: Spodumain Mining Crystal II

18626.description:
The moon survey probe is launched in the direction of a nearby moon where it will eventually land and broadcast back atmospheric and soil analysis data.

The Quest is a cheap compact system that requires little in the way of skill to operate. However, it is extremely slow and can take up to 20 minutes to gather reliable survey data.
18626.name: Quest Survey Probe I

18635.description:
The moon survey probe is launched in the direction of a nearby moon where it will eventually land and broadcast back atmospheric and soil analysis data.

The Discovery is the standard probe used by most moon mining operations. It is fairly fast - completing its survey in about 5 minutes - but that benefit is offset by its rather considerable bulk.
18635.name: Discovery Survey Probe I

18637.description:
The moon survey probe is launched in the direction of a nearby moon where it will eventually land and broadcast back atmospheric and soil analysis data.

The Gaze system is a extremely fast survey system that can reliably scan a moon in under 2.5 minutes. However, it requires considerable skill to use.
18637.name: Gaze Survey Probe I

18639.description:
Launcher for Core Scanner Probes and Combat Scanner Probes.

Core Scanner Probes are used to scan down Cosmic Signatures in space.
Combat Scanner Probes are used to scan down Cosmic Signatures, starships, structures and drones.

Note: Only one scan probe launcher can be fitted per ship.
18639.name: Expanded Probe Launcher I

19470.description: An anchorable reprocessing array, able to take raw ores and process them into minerals. Has a lower reprocessing yield than fully upgraded outposts, but due to its mobile nature it is very valuable to frontier industrialists who operate light years away from the nearest permanent installation. This unit is for use in low and null security space only.
19470.name: Intensive Reprocessing Array

19534.description:
This ocular filter has been modified by Blood Raider scientists for use by their elite officers. 

Primary Effect: +4 bonus to Perception

Secondary Effect: 1% reduction in the duration of modules requiring the Capacitor Emission Systems skill

Set Effect: 15% bonus to the strength of all Talisman implant secondary effects
19534.name: High-grade Talisman Alpha

19720.description:
The Revelation represents the pinnacle of Amarrian military technology. Maintaining their proud tradition of producing the strongest armor plating to be found anywhere, the Empire's engineers outdid themselves in creating what is arguably the most resilient dreadnought in existence.

Added to that, the Revelation's ability to fire capital beams makes its position on the battlefield a unique one. When extended sieges are the order of the day, this is the ship you call in.
19720.name: Revelation

19722.description:
The Naglfar is based on a Matari design believed to date back to the earliest annals of antiquity. While the exact evolution of memes informing its figure is unclear, the same distinctive vertical monolith form has shown up time and time again in the wind-scattered remnants of Matari legend.

Boasting an impressive versatility in firepower options, the Naglfar is capable of holding its own against opponents of all sizes and shapes. While its defenses don't go to extremes as herculean as those of its counterparts, the uniformity of resilience - coupled with the sheer amount of devastation it can dish out - make this beast an invaluable addition to any fleet.
19722.name: Naglfar

19724.description: Of all the dreadnoughts currently in existence, the imposing Moros possesses a tremendous capacity to fend off gargantuan hostiles while still posing a valid threat to any and all larger-scale threats on the battlefield. By virtue of its protean array of point defense capabilities, and its terrifying ability to unleash rapid and thoroughly devastating amounts of destruction on the battlefield, the Moros is single-handedly capable of turning the tide in a fleet battle.
19724.name: Moros

19726.description:
In terms of Caldari design philosophy, the Phoenix is a chip off the old block. With a heavily tweaked missile interface, targeting arrays of surpassing quality and the most advanced shield systems to be found anywhere, it is considered the strongest long-range installation attacker out there.

While its shield boosting actuators allow the Phoenix, when properly equipped, to withstand tremendous punishment over a short duration, its defenses are not likely to hold up against sustained attack over longer periods. With a strong supplementary force, however, few things in existence rival this vessel's pure annihilative force.
19726.name: Phoenix

19739.description: A battleship mounted launcher used for long range standoffs with other battleships, but less suitable for bombardment of deployed structures. Contains a huge missile capacity, but has a slow firing rate and trouble targeting small, fast ships.
19739.name: Cruise Missile Launcher II

19744.description: The Sigil is a recent ship from Viziam based on an old slave transport design.
19744.name: Sigil

19806.description:
A targeting subsystem that projects an electronic "Tag" on the target thus making it easier to target and hit. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
19806.name: Target Painter II

19808.description:
A targeting subsystem that projects an electronic "Tag" on the target thus making it easier to target and hit. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
19808.name: Partial Weapon Navigation

19810.description:
A targeting subsystem that projects an electronic "Tag" on the target thus making it easier to target and hit. 
This upgraded version of the basic target painter uses patented Peripheral Weapon Navigation Diameter technology to reduce CPU requirements.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
19810.name: Peripheral Compact Target Painter

19812.description:
A targeting subsystem that projects an electronic "Tag" on the target thus making it easier to target and hit. 
This upgraded version of the basic target painter uses patented Parallel Weapon Navigation Transmitter technology to minimize capacitor energy consumption during operation.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
19812.name: Parallel Enduring Target Painter

19814.description:
A targeting subsystem that projects an electronic "Tag" on the target thus making it easier to target and hit. 
This upgraded version of the basic target painter uses the famous Phased Weapon Navigation Array Generation Extron technology to significantly boost optimal range.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
19814.name: Phased Scoped Target Painter

19994.description:
This ammo uses a simple lead slug encased in a hard shell of crystalline carbon. It is fairly cheap and works very well against most armors. Shields, however, are a problem.

60% increased optimal range.
5% increased tracking speed.
19994.name: Arch Angel Carbonized Lead M

20002.description:
This is among the most feared ammunition around. It has excellent penetration. Once the ship's outer layer is penetrated, the core explodes, spraying the interior with a cloud of fragmentation fletchets that cause considerable damage to the vulnerable interior structure.

20% increased tracking speed.
20002.name: Arch Angel Titanium Sabot M

20059.description:
The Amarr have always been fond of majestic and intimidating constructions. Their Control Towers do not deviate from that tradition and are truly big and powerful structures, intended more for preservation of territorial interests than commercial benefits.

Racial Bonuses:
50% bonus to Energy Sentry Optimal Range
25% bonus to Energy Sentry Damage
50% bonus to Silo Cargo Capacity
20059.name: Amarr Control Tower Medium

20060.description:
The Amarr have always been fond of majestic and intimidating constructions. Their Control Towers do not deviate from that tradition and are truly big and powerful structures, intended more for preservation of territorial interests than commercial benefits.

Racial Bonuses:
50% bonus to Energy Sentry Optimal Range
25% bonus to Energy Sentry Damage
50% bonus to Silo Cargo Capacity
20060.name: Amarr Control Tower Small

20061.description:
At first the Caldari Control Towers were manufactured by Kaalakiota, but since they focused their efforts mostly on other, more profitable installations, they soon lost the contract and the Sukuuvestaa corporation took over the Control Towers' development and production.

Racial Bonuses:
25% bonus to Missile Battery Rate of Fire
50% bonus to Missile Velocity
-75% bonus to Electronic Warfare Battery Target Cycling Speed
20061.name: Caldari Control Tower Medium

20062.description:
At first the Caldari Control Towers were manufactured by Kaalakiota, but since they focused their efforts mostly on other, more profitable installations, they soon lost the contract and the Sukuuvestaa corporation took over the Control Towers' development and production.

Racial Bonuses:
25% bonus to Missile Battery Rate of Fire
50% bonus to Missile Velocity
-75% bonus to Electronic Warfare Battery Target Cycling Speed
20062.name: Caldari Control Tower Small

20063.description:
Gallente Control Towers are more pleasing to the eye than they are strong or powerful. They have above average electronic countermeasures, average CPU output, and decent power output compared to towers from the other races, but are quite lacking in sophisticated defenses.

Racial Bonuses:
25% bonus to Hybrid Sentry Damage
100% bonus to Silo Cargo Capacity
20063.name: Gallente Control Tower Medium

20064.description:
Gallente Control Towers are more pleasing to the eye than they are strong or powerful. They have above average electronic countermeasures, average CPU output, and decent power output compared to towers from the other races, but are quite lacking in sophisticated defenses.

Racial Bonuses:
25% bonus to Hybrid Sentry Damage
100% bonus to Silo Cargo Capacity
20064.name: Gallente Control Tower Small

20065.description:
The Matari aren't really that high-tech, preferring speed rather than firepower or involved technology. Unfortunately that doesn't apply very well to stationary objects, much to the liking of the Amarr Empire.  

Amarrians call it a scrapheap of epic proportions. But don't underestimate these structures. Minmatar commanders usually have the last laugh when it comes to combat.

Racial Bonuses:
50% bonus to Projectile Sentry Optimal Range
50% bonus to Projectile Sentry Fall Off Range
25% bonus to Projectile Sentry RoF
20065.name: Minmatar Control Tower Medium

20066.description:
The Matari aren't really that high-tech, preferring speed rather than firepower or involved technology. Unfortunately that doesn't apply very well to stationary objects, much to the liking of the Amarr Empire.  

Amarrians call it a scrapheap of epic proportions. But don't underestimate these structures. Minmatar commanders usually have the last laugh when it comes to combat.

Racial Bonuses:
50% bonus to Projectile Sentry Optimal Range
50% bonus to Projectile Sentry Fall Off Range
25% bonus to Projectile Sentry RoF
20066.name: Minmatar Control Tower Small

20069.description:
Reduces the capacitor need of the fleet's personal and targeted armor repair systems.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield. The Fleet bonus provided by this module does not apply to Capital sized local repair modules.
20069.name: Armored Warfare Link - Damage Control I

20070.description:
Lowers the signature radius of ships in the fleet.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
20070.name: Skirmish Warfare Link - Evasive Maneuvers I

20110.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
20110.name: Sleeper Foundation Block

20124.description:
Increases the speed of the fleet's shield boosters and decreases the duration of shield transporters. Will not affect Capital-sized personal shield boosters.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
20124.name: Siege Warfare Link - Active Shielding I

20125.description: Built to represent the last word in electronic warfare, combat recon ships have onboard facilities designed to maximize the effectiveness of electronic countermeasure modules of all kinds. Filling a role next to their class counterpart, the heavy assault cruiser, combat recon ships are the state of the art when it comes to anti-support support. They are also devastating adversaries in smaller skirmishes, possessing strong defensive capabilities in addition to their electronic superiority.
20125.name: Curse

20138.description: A launcher intended for use on cruiser-class spacecraft. While assault launchers do not possess the sheer damage-dealing capability of regular heavy missile launchers, their blend of speed and attack power lends them application across a good range of tactical situations.
20138.name: Heavy Assault Missile Launcher I

20175.description: This structure has been automatically disabled by CONCORD to make way for newer replacement technology.
20175.name: Simple Reactor Array

20183.description: Even though characteristically last in the race to create a working prototype of new technology, the Empire's engineers spared no effort in bringing the Providence into the world. While the massive potential for profit from the capsuleer market is said to have been what eventually made the stolid Empire decide to involve themselves in the freighter business, their brainchild is by no means the runt of the litter; the Providence is one of the sturdiest freighters out there.
20183.name: Providence

20185.description:
As the makers of the Charon, the Caldari State are generally credited with pioneering the freighter class. Recognizing the need for a massive transport vehicle as deep space installations constantly increase in number, they set about making the ultimate in efficient mass transport - and were soon followed by the other empires.

Regardless, the Charon still stands out as the benchmark by which the other freighters were measured. Its massive size and titanic cargo hold are rivalled by none.
20185.name: Charon

20187.description: The Obelisk was designed by the Federation in response to the Caldari State's Charon freighter. Possessing similar characteristics but placing a greater emphasis on resilience, this massive juggernaut represents the latest, and arguably finest, step in Gallente transport technology.
20187.name: Obelisk

20189.description: Third in line to jump on the freighter bandwagon, the Republic decided early in the design process to focus on a balance between all ship systems. True to form, their creation is comparatively lightweight - though lightweight is certainly not a term easily applicable to this giant.
20189.name: Fenrir

20218.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20218.name: Conjunctive Radar ECCM Scanning Array I

20224.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20224.name: Conjunctive Ladar ECCM Scanning Array I

20230.description:
A secondary electronic array that provides a significant boost to sensor strength for a short time. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20230.name: Conjunctive Gravimetric ECCM Scanning Array I

20236.name: Conjunctive Magnetometric ECCM Scanning Array I

20238.description:
A backup system which operates in conjunction with the main array. Reduces the ship's vulnerability to jamming.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20238.name: Secure Gravimetric Backup Cluster I

A backup system which operates in conjunction with the main array. Reduces the ship's vulnerability to jamming.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20262.name: Shielded Radar Backup Cluster I

20264.description:
A backup system which operates in conjunction with the main array. Reduces the ship's vulnerability to jamming.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20264.name: Warded Radar Backup Cluster I

20280.description:
An electronic interface designed to augment and enhance a dreadnought's siege warfare abilities. Through a series of electromagnetic polarity field shifts, the siege module diverts energy from the ship's propulsion and warp systems to lend additional power to its offensive and defensive capabilities.

This results in a tremendous increase in damage, as well as a greatly increased rate of defensive self-sustenance. Defensive benefits include improved self-repair and shield boosting effectiveness, as well as increased resistance to most forms of electronic warfare. As a side effect of the ionic field created by the siege module, beneficial remote repair and capacitor transfer effects are ineffective against the fitted ship while the module is active.
In addition, the lack of power to locomotion systems means that neither standard propulsion nor warp travel are available to the ship nor are you allowed to dock until out of siege mode.

Notes: 
- A siege module requires Strontium clathrates to run and operate effectively. 
- Bonuses to the Shield Booster amount and duration are only applied to Capital sized boosters.
- Bonuses to the Armor Repairer amount and duration are only applied to Capital sized repairers.
- Only one siege module can be fitted to a dreadnought class ship. The increased shield boosting and armor repairing gained from the Siege Module is subject to a stacking penalty when used with other similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship.
20280.name: Siege Module I

20306.description: An EMP warhead designed for use with heavy assault launchers. Heavy assault missiles can be fired at a greater rate than heavy missiles, at the expense of effective range.
20306.name: Mjolnir Heavy Assault Missile

20307.description: A kinetic warhead designed for use with heavy assault launchers. Heavy assault missiles can be fired at a greater rate than heavy missiles, at the expense of effective range.
20307.name: Scourge Heavy Assault Missile

20308.description: A plasma warhead designed for use with heavy assault launchers. Heavy assault missiles can be fired at a greater rate than heavy missiles, at the expense of effective range.
20308.name: Inferno Heavy Assault Missile

20343.description:
Increases the maximum strength of the Armor.

Penalty: Adds to your ship's mass, making it less agile and maneuverable in addition to decreasing the factor of thrust gained from speed modules like Afterburners and MicroWarpdrives.
20343.name: 50mm Steel Plates II

20345.description:
Increases the maximum strength of the Armor.

Penalty: Adds to your ship's mass, making it less agile and maneuverable in addition to decreasing the factor of thrust gained from speed modules like Afterburners and MicroWarpdrives.

20353.name: 1600mm Steel Plates II

20367.description: This singnature scrambler has been modified to mask the cargo hold of the ship making it harder to detect contraband.
20367.name: Smugglers Mask I

20405.description:
Increases range of modules requiring Electronic Warfare, Sensor Linking, Target Painting or Weapon Disruption for all ships in the fleet.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
20405.name: Information Warfare Link - Recon Operation I

20406.description:
Boosts the strength of the fleet's electronic warfare modules.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
20406.name: Information Warfare Link - Electronic Superiority I

20408.description:
Increases the speed of the fleet's afterburner and microwarpdrive modules.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems.

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
20408.name: Skirmish Warfare Link - Rapid Deployment I

20409.description:
Grants a bonus to the fleet's armor resistances.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
20409.name: Armored Warfare Link - Passive Defense I

20431.description: An extremely dense but flexible alloy of Morphite that seems to be a common component in most Talocan technology. Although the process of creating Black Morphite is somewhat understood it still requires huge amounts of ingrediences to synthesize in usable quantities.
20431.name: Black Morphite

20444.description:
One of the largest weapons currently in existence, this massive laser is designed for extended sieges of stationary installations and other large targets.
Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
20444.name: Dual Giga Pulse Laser I

20446.description:
One of the largest weapons currently in existence, this massive laser is designed for extended sieges of stationary installations and other large targets.
Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.

Requires frequency crystal ammo types: Gamma, Infrared, Microwave, Multifrequency, Radio, Standard, Ultraviolet, Xray.
20446.name: Dual Giga Beam Laser I

20448.description:
One of the largest weapons currently in existence, this massive railgun is designed for extended sieges of stationary installations and other large targets.
Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
20448.name: Dual 1000mm Railgun I

20450.description:
One of the largest weapons currently in existence, this massive blaster is designed for extended sieges of stationary installations and other large targets.
Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
20450.name: Ion Siege Blaster I

20452.description:
One of the largest weapons currently in existence, this massive autocannon is designed for extended sieges of stationary installations and other large targets.
Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
20452.name: Hexa 2500mm Repeating Cannon I

20454.description:
One of the largest weapons currently in existence, this massive artillery cannon is designed for extended sieges of stationary installations and other large targets.
Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
20454.name: Quad 3500mm Siege Artillery I

20514.description:
Boosts all shield resistances for the fleet's ships.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
20514.name: Siege Warfare Link - Shield Harmonizing I

20539.description:
The size of a small cruiser, this massive launcher is designed for extended sieges of stationary installations and other large targets.
Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.
20539.name: XL Torpedo Launcher I

20555.description: Provides a quick injection of power into the capacitor.
20555.name: Small 'Siesta' Capacitor Booster

20557.description: Provides a quick injection of power into the capacitor.
20557.name: Medium 'Gattotte' Capacitor Booster

20559.description: Provides a quick injection of power into the capacitor.
20559.name: Heavy 'Brave' Capacitor Booster

20561.description:
This prototype of an advanced cloaking mechanism was one of the last major technological breakthroughs to come out of Crielere Labs. Although it does work it is not really a finished product and has some serious drawbacks, most notably the fact that the module creates high sensor disruption while fitted and can not operate unless at minimum velocity.

Note: Fitting two or more cloaking devices to a ship negates their use, as unsynchronized light deflection causes interference.
20561.name: Prototype 'Poncho' Cloaking Device I

20563.description:
A very specialized piece of technology, the covert ops cloak is designed for use in tandem with specific covert ops vessels. Although it could theoretically work on other ships, its spatial distortion field is so unstable that trying to compensate for its fluctuations will overwhelm non-specialized computing hardware.

Note: This particular module is advanced enough that it allows a ship to warp while cloaked. However, fitting two or more cloaking devices to a ship negates their use, as unsynchronized light deflection causes interference.
20563.name: 'Smokescreen' Covert Ops Cloaking Device II

20565.description:
An Improved Cloaking device based on the Crielere Labs prototype. It performs better and allows for faster movement while cloaked.

Note: Fitting two or more cloaking devices to a ship negates their use, as unsynchronized light deflection causes interference.
20565.name: Improved 'Guise' Cloaking Device II

20573.description: Projects a low intensity field of ionized particles to disrupt the effectiveness of enemy sensors. Very effective against the Magnetometric-based sensors used by Gallente, Serpentis, ORE and SoE ships.
20573.name: 'Marshall' Magnetometric ECM

20575.description: Analyzes incoming targeting signals and attempts to counter them by emitting an out-of-phase signal back. Great against Ladar targeting systems such as those found on Minmatar and Angel Cartel ships.
20575.name: 'Gambler' Ladar ECM

20577.description: Projects random bursts of gravitons that disrupt accurate targeting. As expected this system works best against Gravimetric targeting systems such as those found on Caldari, Guristas and Mordu's Legion ships.
20577.name: 'Plunderer' Gravimetric ECM

20579.description: Disrupts enemy targeting by generating a field of random sensor noise. Works especially well against the Radar systems incorporated into ships built by the Amarr, Blood Raiders, Sansha's Nation and Triglavian Collective.
20579.name: 'Heist' Radar ECM

20581.description:
Emits random electronic bursts which have a chance of momentarily disrupting target locks on ships within range.

This module can be equipped to Battleship, Marauder, Black Ops, Command Ship, Hauler, Blockade Runner, and Deep Space Transport ships.

Note: Only one module of this type can be activated at the same time. Additionally, fitting a Burst Jammer module will disable interdiction nullification.
20581.name: 'Ghost' Burst Jammer

20587.description:
This is a standard long-range railgun designed for frigates. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
20587.name: 150mm 'Musket' Railgun

20589.description:
Cruiser-sized large barrel turret. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
20589.name: 250mm 'Flintlock' Railgun

20591.description:
This large battleship-sized weapon packs quite a punch. Railguns use magnetic rails to fire solid chunks of matter at hypersonic speed. The accurate range of railguns is very good, but due to technical limitations it cannot use onboard guidance. This results in a fairly rapid drop in accuracy at extreme ranges. 

Requires hybrid charge types: Antimatter, Iridium, Iron, Lead, Plutonium, Thorium, Tungsten, Uranium.
20591.name: 425mm 'Popper' Railgun

20593.description: A tiny launcher that can carry a very limited supply of rockets. Not really intended as a primary weapon but rather as a cheap supplementary weapon system.
20593.name: 'Balefire' Rocket Launcher

20595.description: Favored by many for its average capacity and firing rate. Useful in both fast attack raids and longer battles.
20595.name: 'Gallows' Light Missile Launcher

20597.description: Launcher for cruisers intended to counter fast frigates, can only be fitted with regular light missiles.
20597.name: 'Pickaxe' Rapid Light Missile Launcher

20599.description: Designed for long engagements between medium sized ships. Slow firing rate, but makes up for it with a large missile capacity.
20599.name: 'Undertaker' Heavy Missile Launcher

20601.description: A battleship mounted launcher used for long range standoffs with other battleships, but less suitable for bombardment of deployed structures. Contains a huge missile capacity, but has a slow firing rate and trouble targeting small, fast ships.
20601.name: 'Noose' Cruise Missile Launcher

20603.description: A massive launcher designed for extended bombardments of hard targets like battleships and stations. Contains a huge missile capacity, but has a slow firing rate and trouble targeting small, fast ships.
20603.name: 'Barrage' Torpedo Launcher

20605.description:
Boosts the explosive resistance of the shield.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20605.name: 'Whiskey' Explosive Shield Amplifier

20607.description:
Boosts the thermal resistance of the shield.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20607.name: 'High Noon' Thermal Shield Amplifier

20609.description:
Boosts the kinetic resistance of the shield.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20609.name: 'Cactus' Modified Kinetic Shield Amplifier

20611.description:
Boosts the EM resistance of the shield.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20611.name: 'Prospector' EM Shield Amplifier

20613.description:
Focuses and amplifies the efficiency of shield boosting modules. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
20613.name: 'Glycerine' Shield Boost Amplifier

20617.description: Expends energy to provide a quick boost in shield strength.
20617.name: Small 'Settler' Shield Booster

20619.description: Expends energy to provide a quick boost in shield strength.
20619.name: Medium 'Lone Ranger' Shield Booster

20621.description: Expends energy to provide a quick boost in shield strength.
20621.name: Large 'Outlaw' Shield Booster

20623.description: Expends energy to provide a quick boost in shield strength.
20623.name: X-Large 'Locomotive' Shield Booster

20625.description: Increases the maximum strength of the shield.
20625.name: Small 'Wolf' Shield Extender

20627.description: Increases the maximum strength of the shield.
20627.name: Small 'Trapper' Shield Extender

20629.description: Increases the maximum strength of the shield.
20629.name: Medium 'Canyon' Shield Extender

20631.description: Increases the maximum strength of the shield.
20631.name: Large 'Sheriff' Shield Extender

20633.description:
Boosts shield resistance against kinetic damage.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module, or similar modules that affect the same resistance type, will result in a penalty to the boost you get on that type of resistance.
20633.name: 'Nugget' Kinetic Shield Hardener

20635.description:
Boosts shield resistance against thermal damage.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module, or similar modules that affect the same resistance type, will result in a penalty to the boost you get on that type of resistance
20635.name: 'Desert Heat' Thermal Shield Hardener

20637.description:
Boosts shield resistance against all damage types.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module, or similar modules that affect the same resistance type, will result in a penalty to the boost you get on that type of resistance.
20637.name: 'Posse' Multispectrum Shield Hardener

20639.description:
Boosts shield resistance against EM damage.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module, or similar modules that affect the same resistance type, will result in a penalty to the boost you get on that type of resistance.
20639.name: 'Poacher' EM Shield Hardener

20641.description:
Boosts shield resistance against explosive damage.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module, or similar modules that affect the same resistance type, will result in a penalty to the boost you get on that type of resistance.
20641.name: 'Snake Eyes' Explosive Shield Hardener

20701.description:
This module uses nano-assemblers to repair damage done to the armor of the ship.

Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.
20701.name: Capital Armor Repairer I

20703.description:
Expends energy to provide a quick boost in shield strength.

Note: May only be fitted to capital class ships.
20703.name: Capital Shield Booster I

21009.description: A centralized propulsion engine designed to send power to a capital ship's thrusters, propelling the behemoth forward.
21009.name: Capital Propulsion Engine

21011.description: A turret hardpoint fitting, engineered to allow extra-large weapon turrets to fit on capital.
21011.name: Capital Turret Hardpoint

21013.description: A vast bank of sensor equipment designed for use with capital ships.
21013.name: Capital Sensor Cluster

21017.description: Gigantic sheets of reinforced armor plating, manufactured for the construction of capital ships.
21017.name: Capital Armor Plates

21019.description: A multiple-thousand kilojoule capacitor battery, engineered for use in capital ships.
21019.name: Capital Capacitor Battery

21021.description: A gigantic hulk of machinery, designed to give life to a capital ship's power core.
21021.name: Capital Power Generator

21023.description: A modular unit designed to create a vast electromagnetic shield around capital ships.
21023.name: Capital Shield Emitter

21025.description: A massive hulk of machinery designed to propel a capital vessel through vast tracts of space, allowing it to make its way between systems without the use of a stargate.
21025.name: Capital Jump Drive

21027.description: Sheets of massive metal which link together to form a multiple-thousand-cubic meter cargo bay, for insertion into capital ships.
21027.name: Capital Cargo Bay

21029.description: Sheets of massive metal which link together to form a fully functional drone bay, for insertion into capital ships.
21029.name: Capital Drone Bay

21035.description: Onboard electronic interfaces and data banks, required for the operation of capital ships.
21035.name: Capital Computer System

21037.description: Various mechanical and electronic parts for the construction of capital ships.
21037.name: Capital Construction Parts

21039.description: An electronic interface responsible for rerouting a dreadnought's energy from its propulsion systems towards its defensive and offensive systems.
21039.name: Capital Siege Array

21041.description: A launcher hardpoint fitting, engineered to allow XL-class missile launchers to fit on capital ships.
21041.name: Capital Launcher Hardpoint

21054.description: A crude, but old, sculpture of a Gallente citizen.
21054.name: Crude Sculpture

21073.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21073.name: Sleeper Split Cables

21075.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21075.name: Talocan Molecule Binder

21078.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21078.name: Talocan Reflective Sheets

21081.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21081.name: Talocan Mechanical Gears

21086.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21086.name: Talocan Partition Plates

21089.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21089.name: Talocan Ignition Device

21094.description: A precise frequency energy field, used as a target beacon for jumpdrives.
21094.name: Cynosural Field

21096.description:
Generates a cynosural field for advanced ship jump drives to lock on to.

Note: Can only be fit by Force Recon Ships, Heavy Interdiction Cruisers, and Black Ops.
21096.name: Cynosural Field Generator I

21334.description:
Consists of two components: a shell of titanium and a core of antimatter atoms suspended in plasma state. Railguns launch the shell directly, while particle blasters pump the plasma into a cyclotron and process the plasma into a bolt that is then fired.

50% reduced optimal range.
21334.name: Guristas Antimatter Charge S

21470.description:
Gives a boost to the maximum velocity of the ship when activated. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module.

Note: Usually fit on Frigates and Destroyers.
21470.name: 1MN Analog Booster Afterburner

21472.description:
Gives a boost to the maximum velocity of the ship when activated. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module.

Note: Usually fit on Cruisers and Battlecruisers.
21472.name: 10MN Analog Booster Afterburner

21474.description:
Gives a boost to the maximum velocity of the ship when activated. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module.

Note: Usually fit on Battleships.
21474.name: 100MN Analog Booster Afterburner

21476.description:
Massive boost to speed for a very short time. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module. The sheer amount of energy needed to power this system means that it must permanently reserve a fraction of the capacitor output just to maintain the integrity of its warp containment field, and when activated it substantially increases the ship's EM footprint.

Penalty: Max capacitor reduced.

Note: Usually fit on Frigates and Destroyers.
21476.name: 5MN Digital Booster Microwarpdrive

21478.description:
Massive boost to speed for a very short time. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module. The sheer amount of energy needed to power this system means that it must permanently reserve a fraction of the capacitor output just to maintain the integrity of its warp containment field, and when activated it substantially increases the ship's EM footprint.

Penalty: Max capacitor reduced.

Note: Usually fit on Cruisers and Battlecruisers.
21478.name: 50MN Digital Booster Microwarpdrive

21480.description:
Massive boost to speed for a very short time. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module. The sheer amount of energy needed to power this system means that it must permanently reserve a fraction of the capacitor output just to maintain the integrity of its warp containment field, and when activated it substantially increases the ship's EM footprint.

Penalty: Max capacitor reduced.

Note: Battleship class module.
21480.name: 500MN Digital Booster Microwarpdrive

21482.description:
A computer system designed for monitoring and guiding missiles in flight, thus allowing for superior effectiveness and lethality. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21482.name: Ballistic 'Purge' Targeting System I

21484.description:
A computer system designed for monitoring and guiding missiles in flight, thus allowing for superior effectiveness and lethality. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21484.name: 'Full Duplex' Ballistic Control System

21486.description:
Gives a bonus to the speed and damage of projectile turrets. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21486.name: 'Kindred' Gyrostabilizer

21488.description:
Gives a bonus to the speed and damage of projectile turrets. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21488.name: Monophonic Stabilization Actuator I

21491.description:
This monster unit vastly increases engine power at the expense of cargo capacity.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21491.name: Synthetic Hull Conversion Overdrive Injector

21493.description: Increases cargo hold capacity at the expense of maximum velocity and hull strength.
21493.name: Limited Expanded 'Archiver' Cargo

21496.description: Increases structural hit points while reducing agility and cargo capacity.
21496.name: Synthetic Hull Conversion Reinforced Bulkheads

21498.description:
Improves ship handling and maneuverability.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21498.name: Synthetic Hull Conversion Inertial Stabilizers

21500.description:
Replaces some of the heavier structure components with lighter, but more fragile material. Increases ship's velocity and improves maneuverability at the expense of hull strength.

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21500.name: Synthetic Hull Conversion Nanofiber Structure

21504.description: Makes use of nano-assembler technology in order to repair damage done to the structure.
21504.name: Small 'Integrative' Hull Repair Unit

21506.description: Makes use of nano-assembler technology in order to repair damage done to the structure.
21506.name: Medium 'Integrative' Hull Repair Unit

21508.description: Makes use of nano-assembler technology in order to repair damage done to the structure.
21508.name: Large 'Integrative' Hull Repair Unit

21510.description: Disrupts the target ship's navigation computer which prevents it from warping.
21510.name: 'Interruptive' Warp Disruptor

21512.description: Disrupts the target ship's navigation computer, disabling warping, jumping, microwarpdrives and micro jump drives.
21512.name: 'Delineative' Warp Scrambler

21527.description:
Augments the sensor and electronics suite of the fitted ship. Benefits include additional locked targets, increased maximum target acquisition range, faster locking speed, and increased sensor strength.
Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21527.name: 'Firewall' Signal Amplifier

21534.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes explosive damage to surrounding vessels.
21534.name: 'Degenerative' Small Proton Smartbomb

21536.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes explosive damage to surrounding vessels.
21536.name: 'Dwindling' Medium Proton Smartbomb

21538.description: Radiates an omnidirectional pulse from the ship that causes explosive damage to surrounding vessels.
21538.name: 'Regressive' Large Proton Smartbomb

21540.description:
A targeting subsystem that projects an electronic "Tag" on the target thus making it easier to target and hit. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
21540.name: 'Inception' Target Painter

21542.description: A tiny launcher that can carry a very limited supply of rockets. Not really intended as a primary weapon but rather as a cheap supplementary weapon system.
21542.name: N-1 Neon Type Rocket Bay

21545.description:
A powerful autocannon that can smash apart most lightly armored frigates with ease. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21545.name: 200mm Light 'Jolt' Autocannon I

21547.description:
This artillery is one of the most powerful weapons that can be mounted on a frigate. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21547.name: 250mm Light 'Jolt' Artillery I

21549.description:
Rocket-assisted artillery projectiles designed for long-range combat. It is the most powerful projectile weapon able to be fitted onto frigates. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21549.name: 280mm 'Jolt' Artillery I

21551.description:
The 425mm is a behemoth that will inflict severe damage on most cruisers and frigates in short-range battles. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21551.name: 425mm Medium 'Jolt' Autocannon I

21553.description:
A powerful long-range cannon. One of the most damaging weapons mountable on a cruiser. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21553.name: 650mm Medium 'Jolt' Artillery I

21555.description:
This 720mm rocket-assisted howitzer is designed for long-range bombardment. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21555.name: 720mm 'Jolt' Artillery I

21557.description:
A two-barreled, intermediate-range, powerful cannon capable of causing tremendous damage. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21557.name: 800mm Heavy 'Jolt' Repeating Cannon I

21559.description:
One of the most powerful projectile cannons a battleship can equip. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21559.name: 1200mm Heavy 'Jolt' Artillery I

21561.description:
The ultimate artillery cannon. It hurls death and destruction over incredible distances. 

Must be loaded with any of the following projectile ammo types: Carbonized Lead, Depleted Uranium, EMP, Fusion, Nuclear, Phased Plasma, Proton, or Titanium Sabot.
21561.name: 1400mm 'Jolt' Artillery I

21584.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21584.name: Sleeper Micro Circuits

21585.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21585.name: Sleeper Cryo Batteries

21586.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21586.name: Sleeper Virtual Energizer

21587.name: Electronic Link

21588.name: Spare Parts

21589.name: Power Couplings

21590.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21590.name: Armor Blocks

21591.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21591.name: Computer Chips

21592.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21592.name: Electric Conduit

21593.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21593.name: Mechanic Parts

21594.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21594.name: Energy Cells

21595.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21595.name: Construction Alloy

21596.description: Alloys and special materials used in the manufacture of modules based on Ancient technology.
21596.name: Data Processor

21628.description: Caldari Shuttle registered to the Guristas organization.
21628.name: Guristas Shuttle

21815.description: A tiny chip with a modified silicon-extract wafer forming the base for an integrated circuit. The chip stores the code for the elite drone's artificial intelligence.
21815.name: Elite Drone AI

21853.description: This module uses nano-assemblers to repair damage done to the armor of the ship.
21853.name: Civilian Armor Repairer

21855.description: Increases cargo hold capacity at the expense of maximum velocity and hull strength.
21855.name: Civilian Expanded Cargohold

21857.description:
Gives a boost to the maximum velocity of the ship when activated. The thrust that boosts the ship, and the corresponding maximum velocity bonus, are limited by the mass of the ship that uses this module.

Note: Usually fit on Frigates and Destroyers.
21857.name: 1MN Civilian Afterburner

21867.description: A nuclear warhead designed for use with heavy assault launchers. Heavy assault missiles can be fired at a greater rate than heavy missiles, at the expense of effective range.
21867.name: Nova Heavy Assault Missile

21947.description: Assorted parts of metal, textiles, composite fabrics and miscellaneous machinery - the basic building blocks for the assembly and operation of a space outpost.
21947.name: Structure Construction Parts

21949.description: Components for the construction of individualized ship and module hangars in space outposts.
21949.name: Structure Hangar Array

21951.description: One of the myriad construction components required for the building of space outposts.
21951.name: Structure Storage Bay

21953.description: Construction materials and research tools for space outpost laboratories.
21953.name: Structure Laboratory

21955.description: Materials required for the construction of factory facilities in a space outpost.
21955.name: Structure Factory

21957.description: Lathes, grinders, riveting machines, uncoilers, and various other pieces of machinery required for the operation of an outpost repair facility.
21957.name: Structure Repair Facility

21959.description: Parts required for the construction of a space outpost materials refinery.
21959.name: Structure Reprocessing Plant

21961.description: Mechanical components required for the construction of an outpost docking bay.
21961.name: Structure Docking Bay

21963.description: Market access electronics and secure storage facilities of market goods for space outposts.
21963.name: Structure Market Network

21965.description: Medicine, anaesthetics, surgical supplies and complete cloning facilities for space outposts.
21965.name: Structure Medical Center

21967.description: Materials for the construction of dozens of offices, as well as computer systems and supplies needed for their day-to-day running.
21967.name: Structure Office Center

21969.description: A computerized interface allowing people to barter goods and services with the outpost acting as centralized broker and data bank.
21969.name: Structure Mission Network

22175.description:
A Hacking system used to override electronic security systems, potentially providing access to valuable data or items.

Note: Due to recently discovered branch prediction vulnerabilities in certain Upwell Consortium Recursive Computing Modules this analyzer may also be used to collect sensitive information concerning reinforcement periods of Upwell Structures.
22175.name: Data Analyzer I

22177.description:
An archaeology system used to analyze and search ancient ruins, potentially revealing valuable items for collection.

Note: Due to recently discovered branch prediction vulnerabilities in certain Upwell Consortium Recursive Computing Modules this analyzer may also be used to collect sensitive information concerning reinforcement periods of Upwell Structures.
22177.name: Relic Analyzer I

22227.description:
Increases the speed of the fleet's personal and targeted armor repair systems.
Will not affect Capital-sized personal repair modules.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield.
22227.name: Armored Warfare Link - Rapid Repair I

22228.description:
Reduces the capacitor need of the fleet's shield boosters and shield transporters.

Warfare links are dedicated fleet command systems designed for use on battlecruisers and advanced command class ships.

While only one of these units can normally be operated at any given time, certain advanced units allow the use of multiple systems. 

Notes: The Fleet bonus only works if you are the assigned fleet booster. This module cannot activate inside a starbase forcefield. The Fleet bonus provided by this module does not apply to Capital sized local booster modules.
22228.name: Siege Warfare Link - Shield Efficiency I

22229.description: A unit used to extract valuable materials from ice asteroids. Used on Mining barges and Exhumers.
22229.name: Ice Harvester II

22291.description:
A computer system designed for monitoring and guiding missiles in flight, thus allowing for superior effectiveness and lethality. 

Penalty: Using more than one type of this module or similar modules that affect the same attribute on the ship will be penalized.
22291.name: Ballistic Control System II

22325.description: A Hacking system used to override electronic security systems.
22325.name: 'Daemon' Data Analyzer I

22327.description: A Hacking system used to override electronic security systems.
22327.name: 'Codex' Data Analyzer I

22329.description: A Hacking system used to override electronic security systems.
22329.name: 'Alpha' Data Analyzer I

22331.description: A Hacking system used to override electronic security systems.
22331.name: 'Libram' Data Analyzer I

22428.description: Black Ops battleships are designed for infiltration and espionage behind enemy lines. With the use of a jump drive and portal generator, they are capable of making a special type of jump portal usable only by covert ops vessels. This enables them to stealthily plant reconnaissance and espionage forces in enemy territory. For the final word in clandestine maneuvers, look no further.
22428.name: Redeemer

22430.description:
Black Ops battleships are designed for infiltration and espionage behind enemy lines. With the use of a jump drive and portal generator, they are capable of making a special type of jump portal usable only by covert ops vessels. This enables them to stealthily plant reconnaissance and espionage forces in enemy territory. For the final word in clandestine maneuvers, look no further.

As the largest drone developer and manufacturer in space, CreoDron has a vested interest in drone carriers. While sacrificing relatively little in the way of defensive capability, the Sin can chew its way through surprisingly strong opponents - provided, of course, that the pilot uses top-of-the-line CreoDron drones.
22430.name: Sin

22436.description: Black Ops battleships are designed for infiltration and espionage behind enemy lines. With the use of a jump drive and portal generator, they are capable of making a special type of jump portal usable only by covert ops vessels. This enables them to stealthily plant reconnaissance and espionage forces in enemy territory. For the final word in clandestine maneuvers, look no further.
22436.name: Widow

22440.description: Black Ops battleships are designed for infiltration and espionage behind enemy lines. With the use of a jump drive and portal generator, they are capable of making a special type of jump portal usable only by covert ops vessels. This enables them to stealthily plant reconnaissance and espionage forces in enemy territory. For the final word in clandestine maneuvers, look no further.
22440.name: Panther

22442.description:
Command ships are engineered specifically to wreak havoc on a battlefield of many. Sporting advanced command module interfaces, these vessels are more than capable of turning the tide in large engagements. Command ships represent the ultimate in Command Burst efficiency; the boosts they give their comrades in combat make them indispensable assets to any well-rounded fleet.

As the largest drone developer and manufacturer in space, CreoDron has a vested interest in drone carriers. While sacrificing relatively little in the way of defensive capability, the Eos can chew its way through surprisingly strong opponents - provided, of course, that the pilot uses top-of-the-line CreoDron drones.
22442.name: Eos

22444.description: Command ships are engineered specifically to wreak havoc on a battlefield of many. Sporting advanced command module interfaces, these vessels are more than capable of turning the tide in large engagements. Command ships represent the ultimate in Command Burst efficiency; the boosts they give their comrades in combat make them indispensable assets to any well-rounded fleet.
22444.name: Sleipnir

Command ships represent the ultimate in Command Burst efficiency; the boosts they give their comrades in combat make them indispensable assets to any well-rounded fleet.

Sporting advanced command module interfaces, these vessels are more than capable of turning the tide in large engagements. Command ships represent the ultimate in Command Burst efficiency; the boosts they give their comrades in combat make them indispensable assets to any well-rounded fleet.
22448.name: Absolution

22452.description: Interdictors are destroyer-sized vessels built to fill a single important tactical niche: the breaching of enemy warp tunnels. Capable of launching warp-disrupting interdiction spheres, interdictors are of great value in locations of strategic importance where enemy movement must be restricted. Additionally, much like their destroyer-class progenitors, they are well-suited to offensive strikes against frigate-sized craft.
22452.name: Heretic

22456.description: Interdictors are destroyer-sized vessels built to fill a single important tactical niche: the breaching of enemy warp tunnels. Capable of launching warp-disrupting interdiction spheres, interdictors are of great value in locations of strategic importance where enemy movement must be restricted. Additionally, much like their destroyer-class progenitors, they are well-suited to offensive strikes against frigate-sized craft.
22456.name: Sabre

Command ships represent the ultimate in Command Burst efficiency; the boosts they give their comrades in combat make them indispensable assets to any well-rounded fleet.
